A

abort(String) - Method in interface com.augursystems.armi.Client
Called when there's a problem, for example, when the connection to the remote server dies before we receive the expected call response.
acceptRemoteClients() - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
A convenience method to call acceptRemoteClients() on any local network interface, at default ARMI port number
acceptRemoteClients(HostPort, Armi.AccessControl) - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
Starts a socket server to accept remote clients; until then, this Armi instance can only be used to make calls or subscribe.
accepts(Packet) - Method in interface com.augursystems.armi.Filter
 
argsToClassList(Serializable[]) - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
 
Armi - Class in com.augursystems.armi
The ARMI server orchestrates all communication to/from any number of remote ARMI servers and the local clients/listeners.
Armi() - Constructor for class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
Creates an Armi instance, ready for remote calls and subscriptions, but not yet initialized to accept calls/subscriptions from other remote Armi instances.
Armi.AccessControl - Interface in com.augursystems.armi
 
ArmiException - Exception in com.augursystems.armi
Wraps any remote exception; analogous to RMI's RemoteException class.
ArmiException() - Constructor for exception com.augursystems.armi.ArmiException
Creates a plain exception, with no wrapped message or exception.
ArmiException(String) - Constructor for exception com.augursystems.armi.ArmiException
Creates a plain exception, with the given message, but no wrapped exception.
ArmiException(String, Throwable) - Constructor for exception com.augursystems.armi.ArmiException
Creates a plain exception, with the given message, and wrapped exception.
ArmiException(Throwable) - Constructor for exception com.augursystems.armi.ArmiException
Creates a plain exception, with the given wrapped exception, but no message specific to this ArmiException.
ArmiInputStream - Class in com.augursystems.armi
This class is used by Packet.decodeInstance(); you don't normally need to use this class directly.

Execute a remote method, synchronously (like RMI).

Client - Interface in com.augursystems.armi
This interface is implemented by ARMI clients that want to receive asynchronous data.

CommandLine - Class in com.augursystems.armi.demo
The main() class for command line operation; usually just for testing since Armi servers are usually started programmatically within an application.

D

decodeInstance() - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Packet
If this packet's data contains a Java object of the class named in the dataType field, then this method will unmarshall that object; this object is cached so future calls are not expensive.
DEFAULT_CALL_TIMEOUT - Static variable in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
 
DEFAULT_CONNECT_TIMEOUT - Static variable in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
 
DEFAULT_PORT - Static variable in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
The default port (1441) for inter-server ARMI communications; used by the acceptRemoteClients() method, if a null HostPort is specified.

E

equals(Object) - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.HostPort
 

F

Filter - Interface in com.augursystems.armi
This one-method interface can be implemented to filter asynchronous data packets from being transmitted to the associated Client.

getReason() - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Interruptor
The reason why this Interruptor fired is in the InterruptedException's getMessage(); an exception is used (rather than just the text) so that the reason's stack trace is also available, for debugging.
getServiceNames() - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi

getSubscriptionDescriptions() - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
The List<Serializable> of subscriptions types currently tracked; actually the whole list is Strings, of the general format: "[type]/[flavor]".

J

join() - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
Waits until the remote client-accepting thread finishes; used by CommandLine to make sure the JVM doesn't exit immediately, since the thread is a daemon.

P

Packet - Class in com.augursystems.armi
This is the basic wrapper for all messages sent via ARMI.
Packet() - Constructor for class com.augursystems.armi.Packet
This constructor is only used by the unwrapSerializable() utility method.
Packet(Serializable) - Constructor for class com.augursystems.armi.Packet
Wraps a generic Serializable in a Packet; useful to wrap a remote return value of unknown Serializable subtype.
Packet(Serializable, String) - Constructor for class com.augursystems.armi.Packet
Wraps a generic Serializable in a Packet; useful to wrap a remote return value of unknown Serializable subtype.
Packet(String, String, byte, byte[]) - Constructor for class com.augursystems.armi.Packet
Creates a Packet.
parse(String) - Static method in class com.augursystems.armi.HostPort
Parses a string of the form "[host1]:[port1], [host2]:[port2], ..." into an IPv4 HostPort[]; the delimeter is any combination of comma and/or space characters; a colon separates each host and port.
publish(Packet) - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
Called by a local broadcaster, or a remote client via a Receiver.
publish(Serializable) - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
Convenience method that will wrap the Serializable in an ARMI Packet and transmit to all subscribers of its type.
publish(Serializable, String) - Method in class com.augursystems.armi.Armi
Convenience method that will wrap the Serializable in an ARMI Packet and transmit to all subscribers of its type.

This is your receipt for your subscription; hold on to it; you'll need it if you wish to cancel later.
